0x2A.name: MerchantOffers
0x2A.generalDescription: The list of trades a villager NPC is offering.
0x2A.notes: Modifiers can increase or decrease the number of items for the first input slot. The second input slot and the output slot never change the nubmer of items. The number of items may never be less than 1, and never more than the stack size. If special price and demand are both zero, only the default price is displayed. If either is non-zero, then the adjusted price is displayed next to the crossed-out default price. The adjusted prices is calculated as follows: Adjusted price = default price + floor(default price x multiplier x demand) + special price

description.trades.specialPrice: Can be zero or negative. The number is added to the price when an item is discounted due to player reputation or other effects
description.trades.priceMultiplier: Can be low (0.05) or high (0.2). Determines how much demand, player reputation, and temporary effects will adjust the price.

description.isRegularVillager: True if this is a regular villager; false for the wandering trader. When false, hides the villager level and some other GUI elements
description.canRestock: True for regular villagers and false for the wandering trader. If true, the "Villagers restock up to two times per day." message is displayed when hovering over disabled trades.

0x4C.name: SetCamera
0x4C.generalDescription:
Sets the entity that the player renders from. This is normally used when the player left-clicks an entity while in spectator mode.
The player's camera will move with the entity and look where it is looking. The entity is often another player, but can be any type of entity. The player is unable to move this entity (move packets will act as if they are coming from the other entity).
If the given entity is not loaded by the player, this packet is ignored. To return control to the player, send this packet with their entity ID.
The Notchian server resets this (sends it back to the default entity) whenever the spectated entity is killed or the player sneaks, but only if they were spectating an entity. It also sends this packet whenever the player switches out of spectator mode (even if they weren't spectating an entity).
0x4C.notes:
The notchian client also loads certain shaders for given entities:
    Creeper -> shaders/post/creeper.json
    Spider (and cave spider) -> shaders/post/spider.json
    Enderman -> shaders/post/invert.json
    Anything else -> the current shader is unloaded

0x3C.name: SynchronizePlayerPosition
0x3C.generalDescription: Updates the player's position on the server. This packet will also close the “Downloading Terrain” screen when joining/respawning.
0x3C.notes:
- If the distance between the last known position of the player on the server and the new position set by this packet is greater than 100 meters, the client will be kicked for “You moved too quickly :( (Hacking?)”.
   - Also if the fixed-point number of X or Z is set greater than 3.2E7D the client will be kicked for “Illegal position”.
   - Yaw is measured in degrees, and does not follow classical trigonometry rules. The unit circle of yaw on the XZ-plane starts at (0, 1) and turns counterclockwise, with 90 at (-1, 0), 180 at (0, -1) and 270 at (1, 0). Additionally, yaw is not clamped to between 0 and 360 degrees; any number is valid, including negative numbers and numbers greater than 360.
   - Pitch is measured in degrees, where 0 is looking straight ahead, -90 is looking straight up, and 90 is looking straight down.

   About the Flags field:
   <Dinnerbone> It's a bitfield, X/Y/Z/Y_ROT/X_ROT. If X is set, the x value is relative and not absolute.

   - Yaw is measured in degrees, and does not follow classical trigonometry rules. The unit circle of yaw on the XZ-plane starts at (0, 1) and turns counterclockwise, with 90 at (-1, 0), 180 at (0, -1) and 270 at (1, 0). Additionally, yaw is not clamped to between 0 and 360 degrees; any number is valid, including negative numbers and numbers greater than 360.
   - Pitch is measured in degrees, where 0 is looking straight ahead, -90 is looking straight up, and 90 is looking straight down.

   About the Flags field:
   <Dinnerbone> It's a bitfield, X/Y/Z/Y_ROT/X_ROT. If X is set, the x value is relative and not absolute.

description.pitch: Rotation on the y axis, in degrees

0x14.name: SetContainerSlot
0x14.generalDescription: Sent by the server when an item in a slot (in a window) is added/removed.
0x14.notes:
To set the cursor (the item currently dragged with the mouse), use -1 as Window ID and as Slot.
This packet can only be used to edit the hotbar and offhand of the player's inventory if window ID is set to 0 (slots 36 through 45) if the player is in creative, with their inventory open, and not in their survival inventory tab. Otherwise, when window ID is 0, it can edit any slot in the player's inventory. If the window ID is set to -2, then any slot in the inventory can be used but no add item animation will be played.

0x67.name: PickupItem
0x67.generalDescription: Sent by the server when someone picks up an item lying on the ground
0x67.notes: its sole purpose appears to be the animation of the item flying towards you. It doesn't destroy the entity in the client memory, and it doesn't add it to your inventory. The server only checks for items to be picked up after each Set Player Position (and Set Player Position And Rotation) packet sent by the client. The collector entity can be any entity; it does not have to be a player. The collected entity also can be any entity, but the Notchian server only uses this for items, experience orbs, and the different varieties of arrows.

description.sha256Seed: First 8 bytes of the SHA-256 hash of the world's seed. Used client side for biome noise.
description.maxPlayers: Was once used by the client to draw the player list, but now is ignored.
description.simulationDistance: The distance that the client will process specific things, such as entities
description.reducedDebugInfo: If true, a Notchian client shows reduced information on the debug screen. For servers in development, this should almost always be false.
description.enableRespawnScreen: Set to false when the doImmediateRespawn gamerule is true.
description.isDebug: True if the world is a debug mode world; debug mode worlds cannot be modified and have predefined blocks.
description.isFlat: True if the world is a flat world; flat worlds have a fixed height and no terrain generation.
description.deathLocation: The location of the player's last death. If the player has not died, this is null.

0x5E.name: UpdateTime
0x5E.generalDescription: Updates the current time on the world. Can be set via /time set <value>
0x5E.notes:
Time is based on ticks, where 20 ticks happen every second. There are 24000 ticks in a day, making Minecraft days exactly 20 minutes long.
The time of day is based on the timestamp modulo 24000. 0 is sunrise, 6000 is noon, 12000 is sunset, and 18000 is midnight.
The default SMP server increments the time by 20 every second.

description.general: Updates the current time on the world. Can be set via /time set <value>
description.wikiVgNotes:
Time is based on ticks, where 20 ticks happen every second. There are 24000 ticks in a day, making Minecraft days exactly 20 minutes long.
The time of day is based on the timestamp modulo 24000. 0 is sunrise, 6000 is noon, 12000 is sunset, and 18000 is midnight.
The default SMP server increments the time by 20 every second.
description.worldAge: In ticks; not changed by server commands.
description.timeOfDay: The world (or region) time, in ticks. If negative the sun will stop moving at the Math.abs of the time.

0x54.name: SetEntityVelocity
0x54.generalDescription: This packet is used to update the velocity of an entity.
0x54.notes: Velocity is believed to be in units of 1/8000 of a block per server tick (50ms); for example, -1343 would move (-1343 / 8000) = −0.167875 blocks per tick (or −3.3575 blocks per second).

description.general: This packet is used to update the velocity of an entity.
description.wikiVgNotes: Velocity is believed to be in units of 1/8000 of a block per server tick (50ms); for example, -1343 would move (-1343 / 8000) = −0.167875 blocks per tick (or −3.3575 blocks per second).
description.velocityX: The velocity on the X axis.
description.velocityY: The velocity on the Y axis.
description.velocityZ: The velocity on the Z axis.

0x15.name: SetCooldown
0x15.generalDescription: Applies a cooldown period to all items with the given type. Used by the Notchian server with enderpearls. This packet should be sent when the cooldown starts and also when the cooldown ends (to compensate for lag), although the client will end the cooldown automatically.
0x15.notes: Can be applied to any item, note that interactions still get sent to the server with the item but the client does not play the animation nor attempt to predict results (i.e block placing)

description.general: Applies a cooldown period to all items with the given type. Used by the Notchian server with enderpearls. This packet should be sent when the cooldown starts and also when the cooldown ends (to compensate for lag), although the client will end the cooldown automatically.
description.wikiVgNotes: Can be applied to any item, note that interactions still get sent to the server with the item but the client does not play the animation nor attempt to predict results (i.e block placing)
description.item: Item to apply the cooldown to
description.cooldownTicks: Number of ticks to apply a cooldown for, or 0 to clear the cooldown

0x58.name: UpdateObjectives
0x58.generalDescription: This is sent to the client when it should create a new scoreboard objective or remove one.

description.general: This is sent to the client when it should create a new scoreboard objective or remove one.
description.objectiveName: A unique name for the objective.
description.mode: String if the mode is known, otherwise the integer itself
description.objectiveValue: Only if the mode is 0 (Create Scoreboard) or 2 (Update Display Text). The text to be displayed for the score.
description.type: Only if mode is 0 (Create Scoreboard) or 2 (Update Display Text)

0x29.name: MapData
0x29.generalDescription: Updates a rectangular area on a map item. See https://minecraft.fandom.com/wiki/Map for more information.

description.general: Updates a rectangular area on a map item. See https://minecraft.fandom.com/wiki/Map for more information.
description.mapId: Map ID of the map being modified. Should be unique.
description.scale: From 0 for a fully zoomed-in map (1 block per pixel) to 4 for a fully zoomed-out map (16 blocks per pixel)
description.isLocked: True if the map has been locked in a cartography table
description.icons.type: Types are based off of rows and columns in map_icons.png
description.icons.x: Map coordinates: -128 for furthest left, 127 for furthest right
description.icons.z: Map coordinates: -128 for highest, 127 for lowest
description.icons.rotation: 0-15. A direction of 0 is a vertical icon and increments by 22.5 degrees clockwise (360/16)
description.icons.hasDisplayName: If the icon should have a display name
description.icons.displayName: The display name of the icon
description.updateData.x: Only if columns is more than 0: x offset of the westernmost column
description.updateData.z: Only if rows is more than 0: z offset of the northernmost row
description.updateData.rows: Only if columns is more than 0: Number of rows updated
description.updateData.data: Only if columns is more than 0. Single dimension array with rows*columns size. Already converted to ABGR integer format.

0x3F.name: RemoveEntityEffect
0x3F.generalDescription: This packet is sent to remove an effect (e.g. potion effect) from an entity.

description.general: This packet is sent to remove an effect (e.g. potion effect) from an entity.
description.entityId: The entity ID of the entity to remove the effect from.
description.effect: Details of the potion effect being added.

0x60.name: SetTitleAnimationTimes
0x60.generalDescription: Settings for the next/current title being displayed. Most likely being joined with the SetTitleText packet.

description.general: Settings for the next/current title being displayed. Most likely being joined with the SetTitleText packet.
description.stay: Ticks to keep the title displayed.
description.fadeOut: Ticks to spend fading out, not when start fading out.

0x4F.name: SetRenderDistance
0x4F.generalDescription: Sent by the integrated singleplayer server when changing render distance. This packet is sent by the server when the client reappears in the overworld after leaving the end.

description.general: Sent by the integrated singleplayer server when changing render distance. This packet is sent by the server when the client reappears in the overworld after leaving the end.

0x1E.name: UnloadChunk
0x1E.generalDescription: Tells the client to unload a chunk column.
0x1E.notes: It is legal to send this packet even if the given chunk is not currently loaded.

description.general: Tells the client to unload a chunk column.
description.wikiVgNotes: It is legal to send this packet even if the given chunk is not currently loaded.
description.chunkX: Block coordinate divided by 16, rounded down
description.chunkZ: Block coordinate divided by 16, rounded down

0x43.name: UpdateSectionBlocks
0x43.generalDescription: Fired whenever 2 or more blocks are changed within the same chunk on the same tick.
0x43.notes: Changing blocks in chunks not loaded by the client is unsafe (see note on https://wiki.vg/Protocol#Block_Update).

description.general: Fired whenever 2 or more blocks are changed within the same chunk on the same tick.
description.wikiVgNotes: Changing blocks in chunks not loaded by the client is unsafe (see note on https://wiki.vg/Protocol#Block_Update).
description.sectionPos: Chunk section coordinate (encoded chunk x and z with each 22 bits, and section y with 20 bits, from left to right).
description.suppressLightUpdates: Whether to ignore light updates caused by the contained changes. Always inverse the preceding Update Light packet's "Trust Edges" boolean
description.blockLength: Length of the block states array.
description.blocks: Each entry is composed of the block state id, shifted left by 12, and the relative block position in the chunk section (4 bits for x, z, and y, from left to right).

0x65.name: SetTabListHeaderAndFooter
0x65.generalDescription: This packet may be used by custom servers to display additional information above/below the player list. It is never sent by the Notchian server.

description.general: This packet may be used by custom servers to display additional information above/below the player list. It is never sent by the Notchian server.
description.header: To remove the header, send a empty text component: {"text":""}.
description.footer: To remove the footer, send a empty text component: {"text":""}.

0x42.name: SetHeadRotation
0x42.generalDescription: Changes the direction an entity's head is facing. While sending the Entity Look packet changes the vertical rotation of the head, sending this packet appears to be necessary to rotate the head horizontally.

description.general: Changes the direction an entity's head is facing. While sending the Entity Look packet changes the vertical rotation of the head, sending this packet appears to be necessary to rotate the head horizontally.
description.entityId: The entity's ID.

0x49.name: SetBorderSize
0x49.generalDescription: Sets the size of the world border.

description.general: Sets the size of the world border.
description.diameter: Length of a single side of the world border, in meters.

0x2C.name: UpdateEntityPositionAndRotation
0x2C.generalDescription: This packet is sent by the server when an entity rotates and moves. Since a short range is limited from -32768 to 32767, and movement is offset of fixed-point numbers, this packet allows at most 8 blocks movement in any direction. (-32768 / (32 * 128) == -8)

description.general: This packet is sent by the server when an entity rotates and moves. Since a short range is limited from -32768 to 32767, and movement is offset of fixed-point numbers, this packet allows at most 8 blocks movement in any direction. (-32768 / (32 * 128) == -8)
description.entityId: The entity's ID
description.deltaX: Change in X position as (currentX * 32 - prevX * 32) * 128
description.deltaY: Change in Y position as (currentY * 32 - prevY * 32) * 128
description.deltaZ: Change in Z position as (currentZ * 32 - prevZ * 32) * 128
description.yaw: The entity's new yaw, not a delta
description.pitch: The entity's new pitch, not a delta
description.onGround: Whether the entity is on the ground

0x04.name: EntityAnimation
0x04.generalDescription: Sent whenever an entity should change animation.

description.general: Sent whenever an entity should change animation.
description.entityId: The entity ID of the entity that should change animation.

0x1C.name: EntityEvent
0x1C.generalDescription: Entity statuses generally trigger an animation for an entity. The available statuses vary by the entity's type (and are available to subclasses of that type as well).

description.general: Entity statuses generally trigger an animation for an entity. The available statuses vary by the entity's type (and are available to subclasses of that type as well).
description.entityId: The entity's ID

0x62.name: SoundEffect
0x62.generalDescription: Plays a sound effect at the given location, either by hardcoded ID or Identifier. Sound IDs and names can be found here: https://pokechu22.github.io/Burger/1.19.4.html#sounds
0x62.notes: Numeric sound effect IDs are liable to change between versions

description.general: Plays a sound effect at the given location, either by hardcoded ID or Identifier. Sound IDs and names can be found here: https://pokechu22.github.io/Burger/1.19.4.html#sounds
description.wikiVgNotes: Numeric sound effect IDs are liable to change between versions
description.sound: Represents the Sound ID + 1. If the value is 0, the packet contains a sound specified by Identifier.
description.category: The category that this sound will be played from. Current categories: https://gist.github.com/konwboj/7c0c380d3923443e9d55
description.fixedX: Effect X multiplied by 8 (fixed-point number with only 3 bits dedicated to the fractional part).
description.fixedY: Effect Y multiplied by 8 (fixed-point number with only 3 bits dedicated to the fractional part).
description.fixedZ: Effect Z multiplied by 8 (fixed-point number with only 3 bits dedicated to the fractional part).
description.volume: 1.0 is 100%, capped between 0.0 and 1.0 by Notchian clients
description.pitch: Float between 0.5 and 2.0 by Notchian clients.
description.seed: Seed used to pick sound variant.

0x5C.name: SetSimulationDistance
0x5C.generalDescription: Updates the simulation distance of the client.

description.general: Updates the simulation distance of the client.
description.simulationDistance: The distance that the client will process specific things, such as entities.

0x1D.name: Explosion
0x1D.generalDescription: Sent when an explosion occurs (creepers, TNT, and ghast fireballs). Each block in Records is set to air. Coordinates for each axis in record is int(X) + record.x

description.general: Sent when an explosion occurs (creepers, TNT, and ghast fireballs). Each block in Records is set to air. Coordinates for each axis in record is int(X) + record.x
description.strength: A strength greater than or equal to 2.0 spawns a minecraft:explosion_emitter particle, while a lesser strength spawns a minecraft:explosion particle. This field is also used as the radius.
description.records: Each record is 3 signed bytes long; the 3 bytes are the XYZ (respectively) signed offsets of affected blocks.
description.playerMotionX: X velocity of the player being pushed by the explosion.
description.playerMotionY: Y velocity of the player being pushed by the explosion.
description.playerMotionZ: Z velocity of the player being pushed by the explosion.

description.general: No description available.

0x2E.name: MoveVehicle

description.wikiVgNotes: Note that all fields use absolute positioning and do not allow for relative positioning.
description.yaw: Absolute rotation on the vertical axis, in degrees
description.pitch: Absolute rotation on the horizontal axis, in degrees

0x5F.name: SetTitleText
0x5F.generalDescription: Sets the title text. Title will most likely fade in & out when joined with the SetTitleAnimationTimes packet.

description.general: Sets the title text. Title will most likely fade in & out when joined with the SetTitleAnimationTimes packet.

0x4B.name: SetBorderWarningDistance
0x4B.generalDescription: Sets the border warning distance from the border. If the player is inside that distance, the client will display a red vignette in the hud.

description.general: Sets the border warning distance from the border. If the player is inside that distance, the client will display a red vignette in the hud.
description.warningBlocks: The distance from the border at which the client will display a red vignette in the hud.

0x1F.name: GameEvent
0x1F.generalDescription: Used for a wide variety of game events, from weather to bed use to gamemode to demo messages.
0x1F.notes:
Notes on some events:
- No Respawn Block Available: Displays message 'block.minecraft.spawn.not_valid' (You have no home bed or charged respawn anchor, or it was obstructed) to the player.
- Arrow hit player: Sent when any player is struck by an arrow.
- Rain level change: Seems to change both sky color and lighting. Ranges from 0 to 1
- Thunder level change: Seems to change both sky color and lighting (same as Rain level change, but doesn't start rain). It also requires rain to render by notchian client. Ranges from 0 to 1

description.general: Used for a wide variety of game events, from weather to bed use to gamemode to demo messages.
description.wikiVgNotes:
Notes on some events:
- No Respawn Block Available: Displays message 'block.minecraft.spawn.not_valid' (You have no home bed or charged respawn anchor, or it was obstructed) to the player.
- Arrow hit player: Sent when any player is struck by an arrow.
- Rain level change: Seems to change both sky color and lighting. Ranges from 0 to 1
- Thunder level change: Seems to change both sky color and lighting (same as Rain level change, but doesn't start rain). It also requires rain to render by notchian client. Ranges from 0 to 1
description.event: The event name if resolvable, otherwise the id
description.value: The event value if resolvable, otherwise the float

0x12.name: SetContainerContent
0x12.generalDescription: Sent by the server when items in multiple slots (in a window) are added/removed. This includes the main inventory, equipped armour and crafting slots. This packet with Window ID set to "0" is sent during the player joining sequence to initialise the player's inventory.

description.general: Sent by the server when items in multiple slots (in a window) are added/removed. This includes the main inventory, equipped armour and crafting slots. This packet with Window ID set to "0" is sent during the player joining sequence to initialise the player's inventory.
description.windowId: The ID of window which items are being sent for. 0 for player inventory.
description.stateId: The last received State ID from either a Set Container Slot or a Set Container Content packet
description.slotData: An array of slots (item id, count, nbt). See https://wiki.vg/Slot_Data
description.carriedItem: The item the player is currently holding. See https://wiki.vg/Slot_Data

0x40.name: ResourcePack
0x40.generalDescription: This packet is sent by the server to request the client to download a resource pack. The client will, after manually confirming, download the resource pack and send a Resource Pack Status packet back to the server.

description.general: This packet is sent by the server to request the client to download a resource pack. The client will, after manually confirming, download the resource pack and send a Resource Pack Status packet back to the server.
description.url: The URL of the resource pack Max chars: 32767.
description.hash: A 40 character hexadecimal and lowercase SHA-1 hash of the resource pack file. If it's not a 40 character hexadecimal string, the client will not use it for hash verification and likely waste bandwidth — but it will still treat it as a unique id
description.forced: The notchian client will be forced to use the resource pack from the server. If they decline they will be kicked from the server.
description.promptMessage: This is shown in the prompt making the client accept or decline the resource pack.

0x39.name: PlayerInfoRemove
0x39.generalDescription: Used by the server to remove players from the player list.

description.general: Used by the server to remove players from the player list.
description.numPlayers: The number of players to remove from the player list.

0x59.name: SetPassengers
0x59.generalDescription: This packet is sent when an entity changes its passengers.

description.general: This packet is sent when an entity changes its passengers.
description.entityId: The vehicle's entity ID.

0x47.name: SetBorderCenter
0x47.generalDescription: Sets the center of the world border.

description.general: Sets the center of the world border.

0x41.name: Respawn
0x41.generalDescription: To change the player's dimension (overworld/nether/end), send them a respawn packet with the appropriate dimension, followed by prechunks/chunks for the new dimension, and finally a position and look packet. You do not need to unload chunks, the client will do it automatically.
0x41.notes: Avoid changing player's dimension to same dimension they were already in unless they are dead. If you change the dimension to one they are already in, weird bugs can occur, such as the player being unable to attack other players in new world (until they die and respawn). Before 1.16, if you must respawn a player in the same dimension without killing them, send two respawn packets, one to a different world and then another to the world you want. You do not need to complete the first respawn; it only matters that you send two packets.

description.general: To change the player's dimension (overworld/nether/end), send them a respawn packet with the appropriate dimension, followed by prechunks/chunks for the new dimension, and finally a position and look packet. You do not need to unload chunks, the client will do it automatically.
description.wikiVgNotes: Avoid changing player's dimension to same dimension they were already in unless they are dead. If you change the dimension to one they are already in, weird bugs can occur, such as the player being unable to attack other players in new world (until they die and respawn). Before 1.16, if you must respawn a player in the same dimension without killing them, send two respawn packets, one to a different world and then another to the world you want. You do not need to complete the first respawn; it only matters that you send two packets.
description.dimensionType: Valid dimensions are defined per dimension registry sent in Login (play)
description.dimensionName: Name of the dimension being spawned into
description.hashedSeed: First 8 bytes of the SHA-256 hash of the world's seed. Used client side for biome noise
description.previousGamemode: Vanilla client uses this for the debug (F3 + N & F3 + F4) gamemode switch
description.isDebug: True if the world is a debug mode world; debug mode worlds cannot be modified and have predefined blocks.
description.isFlat: True if the world is a flat world; flat worlds have a fixed height and no terrain generation.
description.keepAttributes: True if the player's attributes should be kept. If false, the client will reset the player's attributes to their default values. Wiki.vg seems to conclude these three flags into one 'copyMetadata' boolean
description.keepTrackedData: True if the player's tracked data should be kept. If false, the client will reset the player's tracked data to their default values.
description.keepAll: True if the player's attributes and tracked data should be kept. If false, the client will reset the player's attributes and tracked data to their default values.
description.deathLocation: The location of the player's last death. If the player has not died, this is null.

0x38.name: CombatDeath
0x38.generalDescription: Used to send a respawn screen. This data was once used for twitch.tv metadata circa 1.8.

description.general: Used to send a respawn screen. This data was once used for twitch.tv metadata circa 1.8.
description.player: The player that died (should match the client's entity ID)
description.playerId: The player that died (should match the client's entity ID)
description.killer: The killer entity's ID, or -1 if there is no obvious killer.
description.killerId: The killer entity's ID, or -1 if there is no obvious killer.

0x07.name: SetBlockDestroyStage
0x07.generalDescription: 0–9 are the displayable destroy stages and each other number means that there is no animation on this coordinate. Block break animations can still be applied on air; the animation will remain visible although there is no block being broken. However, if this is applied to a transparent block, odd graphical effects may happen, including water losing its transparency. (An effect similar to this can be seen in normal gameplay when breaking ice blocks)
0x07.notes: If you need to display several break animations at the same time you have to give each of them a unique Entity ID. The entity ID does not need to correspond to an actual entity on the client. It is valid to use a randomly generated number.

description.general: 0–9 are the displayable destroy stages and each other number means that there is no animation on this coordinate. Block break animations can still be applied on air; the animation will remain visible although there is no block being broken. However, if this is applied to a transparent block, odd graphical effects may happen, including water losing its transparency. (An effect similar to this can be seen in normal gameplay when breaking ice blocks)
description.wikiVgNotes: If you need to display several break animations at the same time you have to give each of them a unique Entity ID. The entity ID does not need to correspond to an actual entity on the client. It is valid to use a randomly generated number.
description.entityId: The entity ID of the block break animation. This is used to identify the animation on the client. If you need to display several break animations at the same time you have to give each of them a unique Entity ID. The entity ID does not need to correspond to an actual entity on the client. It is valid to use a randomly generated number.
description.destroyStage: 0–9 to set it, any other value to remove it.

0x0A.name: BlockUpdate
0x0A.generalDescription: Fired whenever a block is changed within the render distance.
0x0A.notes: Changing a block in a chunk that is not loaded is not a stable action. The Notchian client currently uses a shared empty chunk which is modified for all block changes in unloaded chunks; while in 1.9 this chunk never renders in older versions the changed block will appear in all copies of the empty chunk. Servers should avoid sending block changes in unloaded chunks and clients should ignore such packets.

description.general: Fired whenever a block is changed within the render distance.
description.wikiVgNotes: Changing a block in a chunk that is not loaded is not a stable action. The Notchian client currently uses a shared empty chunk which is modified for all block changes in unloaded chunks; while in 1.9 this chunk never renders in older versions the changed block will appear in all copies of the empty chunk. Servers should avoid sending block changes in unloaded chunks and clients should ignore such packets.
description.blockId: The new block state ID for the block as given in the global palette. See https://minecraft.fandom.com/wiki/Data_values#Block_IDs for more information.

0x6C.name: EntityEffect
0x6C.generalDescription: This packet is being used for adding / updating potion effects.

description.general: This packet is being used for adding / updating potion effects.
description.entityId: The entity id of the entity that has the effect.
description.effect: Details of the potion effect being added.
description.amplifier: The amplifier of the potion effect, starting at 0. Notchian client displays effect level as amplifier + 1
description.duration: The effect duration in ticks. -1 means infinite
description.showParticles: Effects with particles hidden are not included in the calculation of the effect color, and are not rendered on the HUD (but are still rendered within the inventory).
description.isAmbient: Set to true if the effect was applied from a beacon. All beacon-generated effects are ambient. Ambient effects use a different icon in the HUD (blue border rather than gray). If all effects on an entity are ambient, the "Is potion effect ambient" living metadata field should be set to true.
description.showIcon: Whether to display an icon in the client hud (Still visible in the inventory)

0x05.name: AwardStatistics
0x05.generalDescription: Sent as a response to Client Command (id 1). Will only send the changed values if previously requested.
0x05.notes: List of all statistics are here: https://wiki.vg/Protocol#Award_Statistics

description.general: Sent as a response to Client Command (id 1). Will only send the changed values if previously requested.
description.wikiVgNotes: List of all statistics are here: https://wiki.vg/Protocol#Award_Statistics

0x50.generalDescription: Sent by the server after login to specify the coordinates of the spawn point (the point at which players spawn at, and which the compass points to). It can be sent at any time to update the point compasses point at.

0x09.generalDescription: This packet is used for a number of actions and animations performed by blocks, usually non-persistent
0x09.notes: The client ignores the provided block type and instead uses the block state in their world. See https://wiki.vg/Block_Actions for a list of values.

description.general: Sends the client a message from a player.
description.wikiVgNotes: Currently a lot is unknown about this packet, blank descriptions are for those that are unknown
description.sender: Used by the Notchian client for the disableChat launch option. Setting both longs to 0 will always display the message regardless of the setting.
description.index: Probably being used by the Report feature. I could track it down to net.minecraft.client.report.log.ChatLog#add, TODO
description.messageSignaturePresent: States if a message signature is present.
description.messageSignatureBytes: Cryptography, the signature consists of the Sender UUID, Session UUID from the Player Session packet, Index, Salt, Timestamp in epoch seconds, the length of the original chat content, the original content itself, the length of Previous Messages, and all of the Previous message signatures. These values are hashed with SHA-256 and signed using the RSA cryptosystem. Modifying any of these values in the packet will cause this signature to fail. This buffer is always 256 bytes long.
description.timestamp: Represents the time the message was signed as milliseconds since the epoch, used to check if the message was received within 2 minutes of it being sent.
description.salt: Cryptography, used for validating the message signature
description.filterType: If the message has been filtered.
description.chatType: The chat type from the Login (play) packet used for this message.

0x48.name: SetBorderLerpSize
0x48.generalDescription: Sets the world border to interpolate between the current diameter and the new diameter over the given number of real-time milliseconds.

description.general: Sets the world border to interpolate between the current diameter and the new diameter over the given number of real-time milliseconds.
description.oldDiameter: Current length of a single side of the world border, in meters.
description.newDiameter: Target length of a single side of the world border, in meters.
description.speed: Number of real-time milliseconds until New Diameter is reached. It appears that Notchian server does not sync world border speed to game ticks, so it gets out of sync with server lag. If the world border is not moving, this is set to 0

0x57.name: SetHealth
0x57.generalDescription: Sent by the server to set the health of the player it is sent to.
0x57.notes: Food saturation acts as a food “overcharge”. Food values will not decrease while the saturation is over zero. New players logging in or respawning automatically get a saturation of 5.0. Eating food increases the saturation as well as the food bar. (https://minecraft.fandom.com/wiki/Food#Hunger_vs._Saturation)

description.food: 0 - 20. The player can only sprint if the food is greater than 6.

0x34.name: PlayerAbilities
0x34.generalDescription: This packet is sent to the client to update the player's abilities. This includes whether the player is invulnerable, flying, and whether they can fly. It also includes the player's current fly and walk speeds.
0x34.notes: The latter 2 floats are used to indicate the flying speed and field of view respectively, while the first byte is used to determine the value of 4 booleans.

description.general: This packet is sent to the client to update the player's abilities. This includes whether the player is invulnerable, flying, and whether they can fly. It also includes the player's current fly and walk speeds.
description.wikiVgNotes: The latter 2 floats are used to indicate the flying speed and field of view respectively, while the first byte is used to determine the value of 4 booleans.
description.invulnerable: Whether the player is invulnerable to damage.
description.allowFlying: Whether the player is allowed to fly.
description.creativeMode: Whether the player is in creative mode.
description.flySpeed: The player's current flying speed. Default: 0.05
description.fieldOfViewModifier: Modifies the field of view, like a speed potion. A Notchian server will use the same value as the movement speed sent in the Update Attributes packet, which defaults to 0.1 for players.

0x11.name: CloseContainer
0x11.generalDescription: This packet is sent from the server to the client when a window is forcibly closed, such as when a chest is destroyed while it's open. The notchian client disregards the provided window ID and closes any active window.

description.general: No description available.

0x23.name: KeepAlive
0x23.generalDescription: The server will frequently send out a keep-alive, each containing a random ID. The client must respond with the same payload (see serverbound Keep Alive). If the client does not respond to them for over 30 seconds, the server kicks the client. Vice versa, if the server does not send any keep-alives for 20 seconds, the client will disconnect and yields a "Timed out" exception.
0x23.notes: The Notchian server uses a system-dependent time in milliseconds to generate the keep alive ID value.

If the client does not respond to them for over 30 seconds, the server kicks the client. description.wikiVgNotes: The Notchian server uses a system-dependent time in milliseconds to generate the keep alive ID value.
description.keepAliveId: The ID of the keep alive packet. This is a random number generated by the server.

0x03.name: SpawnPlayer
0x03.generalDescription: This packet is sent by the server when a player comes into visible range, not when a player joins. This packet must be sent after the Player Info Update packet that adds the player data for the client to use when spawning a player. If the Player Info for the player spawned by this packet is not present when this packet arrives, Notchian clients will not spawn the player entity. The Player Info packet includes skin/cape data. Servers can, however, safely spawn player entities for players not in visible range. The client appears to handle it correctly.
0x03.notes:
When in online mode, the UUIDs must be valid and have valid skin blobs. In offline mode, UUID v3 is used with the String OfflinePlayer:<player name>, encoded in UTF-8 (and case-sensitive). The Notchian server uses UUID.nameUUIDFromBytes, implemented by OpenJDK here.
For NPCs UUID v2 should be used. Note:
"<+Grum> i will never confirm this as a feature you know that :)"
In an example UUID, xxxxxxxx-xxxx-Yxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx, the UUID version is specified by Y. So, for UUID v3, Y will always be 3, and for UUID v2, Y will always be 2

Servers can, however, safely spawn player entities for players not in visible range. The client appears to handle it correctly.

For NPCs UUID v2 should be used. Note:

In an example UUID, xxxxxxxx-xxxx-Yxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx, the UUID version is specified by Y. So, for UUID v3, Y will always be 3, and for UUID v2, Y will always be 2

0x00.name: StatusResponse
0x00.generalDescription: Will be sent after the client sent a Ping Request packet. This contains information about the server itself.
0x00.notes:
After receiving the Response packet, the client may send the next packet to help calculate the server's latency, or if it is only interested in the above information it can disconnect here.
If the client does not receive a properly formatted response, then it will instead attempt a legacy ping. 
- See https://wiki.vg/Server_List_Ping#Status_Response for more information

If the client does not receive a properly formatted response, then it will instead attempt a legacy ping. 
- See https://wiki.vg/Server_List_Ping#Status_Response for more information
description.players.sample: List of players (not all). An id of a sample needs to be a valid UUID format, else the connection will abort.
description.version.name: Readable version name (e.g. 1.19.4)
description.favicon.icon: The favicon should be a PNG image that is Base64 encoded (without newlines: \n, new lines no longer work since 1.13) and prepended with data:image/png;base64,. It should also be noted that the source image must be exactly 64x64 pixels, otherwise the Notchian client will not render the image.

0x02.name: LoginSuccess
0x02.generalDescription: This packet switches the connection state to play.
0x02.notes: The (notchian) server might take a bit to fully transition to the Play state, so it's recommended to wait for the Login (play) packet from the server. The notchian client doesn't send any packets until the Login (play) packet (https://wiki.vg/Protocol#Login_.28play.29).

description.gameProfile: The game profile of the player who logged in.
description.name: Name of the player. Length should be at 16 characters maximum
description.legacy: Whether the player is a legacy player. Most likely indicates a player joining an offline server
description.properties: Properties of the player. TODO: Add example info

0x04.name: LoginPluginRequest
0x04.generalDescription: Used to implement a custom handshaking flow together with Login Plugin Response packet.
0x04.notes:
Unlike plugin messages in "play" mode, these messages follow a lock-step request/response scheme, where the client is expected to respond to a request indicating whether it understood. The notchian client always responds that it hasn't understood, and sends an empty payload.
In Notchian client, the maximum data length is 1048576 bytes.

description.general: Used to implement a custom handshaking flow together with Login Plugin Response packet.
description.wikiVgNotes:

In Notchian client, the maximum data length is 1048576 bytes.
description.messageId: Generated by the server - should be unique to the connection.
description.channel: Name of the plugin channel used to send the data.
description.data: Any data, depending on the channel. The length of this array must be inferred from the packet length.

0x03.name: SetCompression
0x03.generalDescription: Enables compression. If compression is enabled, all following packets are encoded in the compressed packet format. Negative values will disable compression, meaning the packet format should remain in the uncompressed packet format. However, this packet is entirely optional, and if not sent, compression will also not be enabled (the notchian server does not send the packet when compression is disabled).

description.general: Enables compression. If compression is enabled, all following packets are encoded in the compressed packet format. Negative values will disable compression, meaning the packet format should remain in the uncompressed packet format. However, this packet is entirely optional, and if not sent, compression will also not be enabled (the notchian server does not send the packet when compression is disabled).
description.threshold: Maximum size of a packet before it is compressed
